title: Naimark's problem
summary: Naimark's problem is a question in functional analysis asked by Naimark (1951). It asks whether every C*-algebra that has only one irreducible ∗ {\displaystyle *} -representation up to unitary equivalence is isomorphic to the ∗ {\displaystyle *} -algebra of compact operators on some (not necessarily separable) Hilbert space.
